english.segment1: Words and music by Bob Hartman and John Elefante. Based on Matthew 7:24-27, 16:18
english.segment2: The earth is shakin'. It's like a bad dream. This world is crumblin'. Comin' apart at the seam but. I am on the Rock
english.segment3: Everywhere I'm turning it's only bad news. This bomb is tickin' and we're getting to the end of the fuse but. I am on the Rock
english.segment4: (Chorus). I am on the Rock, the sure foundation. I am on the Rock, His revelation. Though the winds may blow. And though the floods may grow. I shall not be moved, 'cause I am on the Rock
english.segment5: The storm's approaching, I'm standing high and dry. Firmly planted on the Rock that is higher than I. I am on the Rock
english.segment6: Kingdoms failing, they fall around me. Plans eroded, and washing away to the sea
english.segment7: There is no Rock in this world but our God
